section.title: Creating ESXi ESX-CONF DVS and Required Portgroup
section.para: The ESX-CONF Distributed Virtual Switch (DVS) is what connects the ESXi host to the &ostack; management network.

The process of creating an ESXi ESX-conf Distributed vSwitch (DVS) has three steps: create a switch, add host and physical adapters, and add a port group. Use the following detailed instructions to create a ESX-conf DVS and a required portgroup.

step.para: Create the switch.
Using the vSphere webclient, connect to the vCenter server.
Under Hosts and cluster, right-click on the appropriate datacenter. Select Distributed Switch > New Distributed Switch.
Name the switch ESX-CONF. Click Next.
Select version 6.0.0 or higher. Click Next.
Under Edit settings, select the appropriate number of uplinks. Uncheck Create a default port group.
Under Ready to complete, verify that the settings are correct and click Finish.
Add host and physical adapters.
Under Networking, find the DVS named ESX-CONF that was just created. Right-click on it and select Manage hosts.
Under Select task, select Add hosts. Click Next.
Click New hosts.
Select the current ESXi host and select OK. Click Next.
Under Select network adapter tasks, select Manage physical adapters and UNCHECK all other boxes. Click Next.

Under Manage physical network adapters, click on the interface you are using to connect the ESXi to the &ostack; management nework. The name would be of the kind vmnic# (for example vmnic0, vmnic1). When the interface is highlighted, select Assign uplink, then select the uplink name to assign or autoassign. Repeat the process for each uplink physical NIC you will be using to connect to the &ostack; data network. When finished, click Next.
Verify that you understand and agree with the information shown by Analyze impact. Click Next.
Verify everything is correct. Click Finish.
Add port group.
Right-click on the DVS (ESX-CONF) that was just created (or modified). Select Distributed Port Group > New Distributed Port Group.
Name the port group ESX-CONF-PG. Click Next.

Click Next.
Click Next.
Under Ready to complete, verify that everything is as expected and click Finish.
